author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Italy's Carige aims to cut gross bad loans to 2.6 bln euros this yr
text:
Feb 9 (Reuters) - Banca Carige says:
* FY LOSS 380.5 MILLION EUROS AFTER 738 MILLION EUROS IN WRITEDOWNS OF IMPAIRED LOANS LAST YEAR
* NET IMPAIRED LOANS 17.1 PERCENT OF TOTAL LOANS AT END-DEC, GROSS IMPAIRED LOAN RATIO 27.0 PCT
* PHASED-IN CET1 RATIO 12.4 PERCENT AT END-DEC VERSUS 10.4 PERCENT AT END-SEPT FOLLOWING CAPITAL RAISING
* TO SELL UTP PORTFOLIO WORTH 500 MILLION EUROS SOON * STUDYING FURTHER SALE OF BAD LOANS FOR UP TO 1 BILLION EUROS
* SEES GROSS BAD LOANS AT 2.6 BILLION EUROS AT END 2018 * NET INTEREST INCOME FELL 9.8 PERCENT VERSUS 2016, TRADING INCOME DOWN 70.9 PERCENT Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: (Reporting by Milan newsroom)
